Class MetadataObject

Namespace
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata
Assembly
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata.ISO19115.Ed2003.dll

The AbstractObject_Type class serves as an abstract base type for geospatial metadata objects in compliance with the ISO 19115 standard. It implements the IObjectIdentification interface, which provides unique identification attributes such as id and uuid.

[IsoType("AbstractObject_Type", IsAbstract = true, IsoType = IsoTypes.ComplexType)]
[JsonObject("AbstractObject")]
public abstract class MetadataObject : ObservableDbEntity, IModel, IObservableModel, INotifyPropertyChanged, IDbId, IObjectIdentification, INullableId, INullableUuid, ITypeReferenced

Remarks

Usage:

  • Used as a base class for other metadata objects that require identification attributes.

Key Features:

  • Ensures change notifications through the ObservableDbEntity base class.
  • The class cannot be instantiated directly but provides a foundation for other metadata objects.
  • Global Unique Identifiers: The id and uuid properties ensure each object instance can be uniquely referenced.

Considerations:

  • The id attribute follows XML ID constraints and must be unique within a document.
  • The uuid should be a globally unique identifier and is represented as a string.
  • As an abstract type, this class must be subclassed before use.

Maps to: AbstractObject_Type ( /2005/gco/gcoBase.xsd )

Properties

Id

Gets/Sets the unique identifier for the object. This attribute's type is defined in the schema as ID and must be unique within an XML document.

[JsonProperty("id")]
public string? Id { get; set; }

Property Value

string

TypeReferenceMetadata

Gets/Sets the union reference.

public TypeReferenceMetadata? TypeReferenceMetadata { get; set; }

Property Value

TypeReferenceMetadata

Remarks

This is either a ReferenceEntity or a NilReasonEntity.

Uuid

Gets/Sets the universally unique identifier (UUID) for the object. This ensures the object can be referenced uniquely across different datasets.

[JsonProperty("uuid")]
public string? Uuid { get; set; }

Property Value

string
